content:
The project is simultaneously registered as a CDM Project activity under the UNFCCC (Project 10326)? ; however it either claims emission reduction under the VCS program or under the CDM, never both, as declared in MR /1.2/. Thus emission reductions generated by project will be solely claimed by PP and PP has the right of use, which is acceptable. Net GHG emission reductions or removals generated by this project will not be used for compliance with an emissions trading program or to meet binding limits on GHG emissions as the host country is not a participant in any emission trading programs or nor does it have any binding limits. PP will not claim the environmental/carbon credits under any other GHG emission reduction scheme for the crediting period under VCS and PP has provided declaration on the same /11/. Hence, there is no possibility of double counting.

Verification team has checked the supportive for the activities that result in the SD contributions from the project activity for each SDG.

SDG Target 6.1: 6.1.1 Proportion of population using safely managed drinking water services; During the monitoring period there was no increase in the population likely to have access to water per locality, as most of the connections had been done during previous MP as confirmed from supportive documents /29/..
